author: Legal Correspondent
text:
A Division Bench of the Hyderabad High Court on Tuesday set aside the order of the single judge who had stayed the operation of suspension passed by the Andhra Pradesh Assembly against Roja, an MLA of the YSR Congress Party.

The Bench, comprising acting Chief Justice Dilip B. Bhosale and Justice P. Naveen Rao, was allowing the writ appeal filed by the A.P. Legislative Affairs departmentchallenging the interim order passed by the single judge last week.

The MLA was suspended from the House for one year in December 2015 and she filed a writ petition in February.

The Bench reminded that there were limitations for judicial review while dealing with a motion passed by an Assembly.

‘Bad in law’

The main contention of the MLA was that the motion was moved under rule 340(2) of the Rules of Procedure and Conduct of Business Rules of business in the Assembly, which provides for suspension for the remaining session, and that a one-year suspension was bad in law.

The bench, speaking through the Acting Chief Justice, reminds that there are limitations for judicial review while dealing with a motion passed by a Legislative Assembly
title: Stay on Roja’s suspension set aside
